result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob G Craver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Straight-Time. Sentence credit of 77 days is granted.
Concurrent with: -With any other sentence in 22CF1206.
-Costs to be paid as a condition of sentence on 22CF1206. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 10/06/2022 Plea and Sentencing Hearing in front of Judge Carter, filed by Court Reporter Cheryl Humpal

Defendant Jacob G Craver in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Jacob G Craver.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.  

Defense is ready to proceed with plea/sentencing. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #2. Court conducts colloquy and finds the Defendant guilty of count #2. Count #1, #3, and #4 are dismissed and read-in. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:	
6 months in the Waukesha County Jail, Straight-time.
Concurrent to: Any other sentence and 22CF1206.
77 Days Credit.

Costs:  $243.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a condition of sentence on 22CF1206.
Alternate:  entry of civil judgment

3:15 PM Defendant Jacob G Craver in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Jacob G Craver. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense states that cases will be resolved, but has been unable to speak to charging DA re: offer that was extended. Defense requests to leave jury status and jury trial dates as set. 

Court leaves jury status and jury trial dates as set.
Signed by Judge Carter on 09/07/2022.

10:08 AM Defendant Jacob G Craver in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Jacob G Craver. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense would like to resolve, but is awaiting a consolidated offer on all cases. 
State confirms there is no global offer at this time. 
Defense believes they are in receipt of all paper discovery, but is unsure re: electronic discovery. 
Defense states that the Defendant was revoked and will be going to Dodge Correctional. 

SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND MADE ON 22CF1207.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Hearing on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:25 AM Defendant Jacob G Craver in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  State provides discovery to defense in court.  Defense has received discovery.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

02:57 PM Defendant Jacob G Craver in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on July 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob G Craver
Current: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188   (Effective: 07-22-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Waukesha, WI 53186

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

02:21 PM Defendant Jacob G Craver in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern Erik Schlueter.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on July 22nd, 2022.
